Name: Athens
History: As the cradle of Western civilization and the birthplace of democracy, Athens was famed as a centre for the arts, learning and philosophy. The Athenians were also powerful warriors, particularly at sea. At its peak, Athens dominated a large part of the Hellenic world for several decades.

Factions.Name: Athenians
Factions.Description: A Hellenic people of the Ionian tribe.

Technologies.Name: Iphicratean Reforms
Technologies.Description: Athenian triremes can train Marines (Epibastes Athenaikos).

Technologies.Name: Long Walls
Technologies.History: The Long Walls of Athens were constructed under the auspices of the wily Themistocles and extended 6 km from the city to the port of Piraeus. This secured the city's sea supply routes and prevented an enemy from starving out the city during a siege.
Technologies.Description: Stone walls can be built in neutral territory. Construction time for walls is reduced by 50%.

Technologies.Name: Othismos
Technologies.History: The classical phalanx formation was developed about VIII century BC. It was eight men deep and up to eight hundred men wide. The men within overlapped their shields, presenting a formidable shield wall brimming with 8 foot spears.
Technologies.Description: The player gains the ability to order spear-armed troops into Phalanx formation, providing greater attack and armor.

Heroes.Name: Themistocles
Heroes.History: The general who persuaded the Athenians to invest their income from silver mines in a war navy of 200 Triremes. A key figure during the Persian Wars, he commanded the victorious Athenian navy at the decisive battle of Salamis in 479 B.C. Later, he pursued an active policy against the Persians in the Aegean, thereby laying the foundations of future Athenian power. However, he was eventually ostracised by the Athenians and forced to flee to the protection of the Persians.

Heroes.Name: Pericles
Heroes.History: Pericles was the foremost Athenian politician of the 5th Century B.C.

CivBonuses.Name: Athenian Navy
CivBonuses.History: The Athenian Navy was greatly feared. The greater skill of their rowers and more experienced sailors ensured superior and crucial speed.

CivBonuses.Name: Athenian Resources
CivBonuses.History: The mines at Laureion in Attica provided Athens with a wealth of silver from which to mint her famous and highly prized coin, The Athenian Owl.
CivBonuses.Description: Storehouse technologies −10% research time and resource costs.

CivBonuses.Name: Hellenic Architecture Resources
CivBonuses.History: The Greeks used stone construction from early Mycenaean times.
CivBonuses.Description: Civic structures +20% health and capture points.

TeamBonuses.Name: Delian League
TeamBonuses.History: Shortly after the great naval victories at Salamis and Mykale, the Greek city-states instituted the so-called Delian League in 478 B.C., whose purpose was to push the Persians out of the Aegean region. The allied states contributed ships and money, while the Athenians offered their entire navy.

Structures.Name: Theatre
Structures.History: Greek theatres were places where the immortal tragedies of Aeschylus, Sophocles, Euripides, and many other talented dramatists were staged to the delight of the populace. They were instrumental in enriching Hellenic culture.
Structures.Special: Nearby centre +20% capture points and +50% territory influence weight; workers everywhere +5% work rate; required for Metropolis Phase. Build limit: 1.
